867699169:
[

Technical Applications Scientist

Company Name Illumina Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Basic Function And Scope Of The Position

This role provides technical direction and support to customers on operation and maintenance of company products. Serves as customer contact on technical and service-related problems. Support will include clinical customers and compliance with local and global clinical guidelines. Demonstrates uses and advantages of products. Works closely with sales and marketing, QA/QC, research and development to address customer concerns, determine corrective action and customer follow-up. May be responsible for a designated region.

Tasks And Responsibilities
  • Professionally, efficiently and conclusively triage, troubleshoot and resolve customer’s technical questions
  • Assist customers with the design and interpretation of gene expression, genotyping and “Next-Generation” sequencing experiments
  • Provide technical guidance regarding the choice and use of the appropriate Illumina product to existing and prospective customers
  • Assist customers with the selection of SNPs for custom genotyping projects by utilizing public and private sources and proprietary software applications
  • Triage and dispatch issues requiring field support to Illumina Engineers and Applications Scientists
  • Log and manage customer issues using Illumina’s issue-tracking database
  • Contributes to technical growth of colleagues in specialty and new projects.
  • Capable to write technical documentation within specialty and identify topics for these.
  • Identifies, initiates, and leads internal projects.
  • Participate in inter-organizational projects as technical resource and provide TS feedback
  • Willing and able to travel internationally for technical training and regional meetings
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.

Preferred Educational Background
  • Ph.D./ M.S or B.S. plus 2 years relevant lab experience in molecular biology, genetics, bioinformatics or related field

Preferred Experience & Skills
  • Hands-on laboratory experience using, developing or troubleshooting a wide range of molecular biology protocols such as PCR, sequencing, gene expression analysis, genotyping, and related procedures
  • Teaching experience desirable
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills required
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication and training skills a MUST
  • Experience working in any service role desired
  • Experience working in a clinical setting desired
Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

Industry

  • Biotechnology
  • Research
  • Medical Devices

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Research
  • Analyst
  • Information Technology

Motor Vehicle Assessor - Heavy, Victoria.

Company Name QBE Insurance Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Looking to join an incredible company with a big brand? Looking to expand your experience as a Motor Assessor?
Role: Heavy Motor Assessor

Location: Melbourne

Term: Full Time

Applications Close Tuesday 18th September

Our business, our culture

QBE is one of the top 20 global general insurers and is recognised as Australia's largest international insurance and Reinsurance Company, with operations in 37 countries around the world.

Working at QBE, we recognise the value of diversity and inclusion in the workplace and support a range of flexible work arrangements to promote a better family/life/work balance.

We offer you a dynamic workplace culture, one that values and leverages the unique ideas, capabilities and experiences you bring irrespective of where you are in the world. We believe this strengthens our ability to deliver on our business goals, particularly as it relates to innovation, growth and our focus on customers.

The opportunity

The opportunity has become available to join our team in Melbourne as a field Heavy Motor Assessor. In this role you will be responsible for assessing the damage and determining the best practice repair method or settlement recommendations for vehicle damage in accordance with industry standards, legislation, the MVIRI and manufacturer repair methods.

You will engage with repairers, suppliers and clients face to face, over the phone or via internet. This role is expected to be performed on road or via other means as required.

To Be Successful In This Role You Will Possess
  • Specialised heavy vehicle assessing skills with a sound understanding of repair methods and settlement types
  • Advanced negotiation and conflict resolution skills
  • Experience in quoting accident damaged vehicles
  • Exceptional customer service delivery
  • Strong written and verbal communication along with an ability to build lasting relationships
  • Quality and cost focussed management of claims
  • Computer/IT competency and excellent planning and time management skills
  • Relevant automotive trade qualification
  • Hold a current driver’s license

Benefits?

At QBE, you will be provided with a competitive remuneration structure and benefits, in an environment that offers support, and encourages career development and learning.

We Offer a Range Of Benefits And Discounts Including
  • Paid Parental leave (inclusive of paid superannuation during this time)
  • Secondment opportunities
  • Employee assistance programme
  • Paid volunteer leave
  • Purchased leave
  • Product discounts
  • Superannuation matching

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

For more information, click the APPLY button to submit your details.

Number Of Openings

1

How To Apply

To submit your application, click "Apply" and follow the step by step process.

Equal Employment Opportunity

QBE is an equal opportunity employer and is required to comply with equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction it operates.

Industry

  • Information Technology and Services
  • Insurance
  • Financial Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Sales
  • Management

You will execute a strategic sales plan to deliver 100% of sales targets week upon week.\xa0

Job description

ABOUT US:

\xa0

Isobar Australia is an award winning creative agency with digital at our heart. We're made up of a team of passionate digital specialists in websites, strategy, analytics, experience design, social media, online advertising, digital marketing campaigns, games, video and print. We have a singular aim to create climates for brands and people to thrive. In so doing, we create better experiences - for ourselves, for our clients and for the world.


ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY


This role presents a chance to join one of Australia’s leading digital agencies. Become an integral part of a high-performing, cross-functional team made up of creatives, designers, developers and social media specialists during this exciting phase of growth for the agency.

We’re seeking an experienced person, with a minimum of 5 years working in an agency environment, to manage the delivery of a diverse range of digital projects including:

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Digital marketing campaigns (emphasis on social media channels, but also includes email, display and website content).

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Content creation (liaising with content creators, photographers and designers).

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Website development (working with designers and developers etc.).

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Website support and maintenance.


ABOUT YOU


The successful applicant will be someone who’s energetic, enthusiastic and thrives in a fast-paced, fun environment. Someone who enjoys the creative process, loves ideas and wants to be a part of making them happen. This will be someone who can think on their feet, acting autonomously without high amounts of oversight to ensure projects are delivered on time and on budget.

Experience in digital mediums is preferred, but not a mandatory. So if you’re a gun Producer or Account Manager and looking to work more in digital realm, this role could be for you.


Tasks include:


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Development of project documentation including estimates, scope of works and change requests.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Management of project budgets, estimates and invoicing.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Development and updates of project timelines.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Resource management, prioritising and scheduling of work.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Running daily/weekly project stand-ups.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Regular communication with clients via email, WIPs, contact reports etc.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Provide internal briefings and feedback.


Skills:


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Highly organised person with a strong attention to detail.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Excellent communications skills and comfortable communicating with senior stakeholders.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Strong commercial acumen, able to input and interpret financial reports.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Understanding of website development principles and practices.


INTERESTED?
\xa0
Great, just send us your CV and anything else that you think we would find interesting – and if we think we would like working together then we will give you a call.


At DAN, a diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and be proud of doing so. \xa0For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures

Contract Coordinator

Company Name Australian Unity Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 64 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Located in Albert Road, South Melbourne
  • Permanent full time role
  • Join us and thrive!

Australian Unity is a national health, wealth and living mutual company providing products and services designed to help people thrive. More than one million Australians have created a brighter future with us. We are a mutual organisation with 280,000 members, more than 7000 employees and generating more than $2 billion in revenues per annum.

Your Role

An exciting opportunity is now available within our Group Governance function for a proactive and highly organised Contract Coordinator. Reporting to Contracts & Knowledge Manager, you will be supporting the Independent & Assisted Living (IAL) business and will be responsible for the provision of high-quality, timely and effective conveyancing and contracting support for the documented legal relationship between the business unit and residents of its Residential Communities. This will include providing high quality resident document management, production of supplier agreements, resident agreements and other documents to support business operations.

This is a great opportunity to work in contract and leasing administration which involves liaising with our sales and operations teams, prospective and former residents, their solicitors and estates.

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • Solid experience in a similar role gained in either an in-house legal team or law firm
  • A background in conveyancing or property development ideal
  • Experience using a document management system an advantage
  • A Certificate or Diploma in conveyancing, legal administration or property management highly regarded
  • A strong working knowledge of MS Office
  • Outstanding attention to detail and accuracy
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • The ability to prioritise and work under pressure with competing demands

Your work at Australian Unity will be focused on helping others to thrive, and so we seek to create a work environment that supports you to thrive in your career. We operate with commercial principles and with a strong social purpose to create community value. The culture at Australian Unity is one that truly operates from its values of Bold, Warm and Honest and we are keen to connect as a priority with those who align with this. We also offer a broad range of benefits and incentives.

Join us and thrive!

The opportunity and role

Join one of Australia’s most innovative and forward-thinking businesses

About Dan Murphy’s

When Dan Murphy opened his first liquor store in 1952, he believed in offering the biggest range, the lowest prices and unbeatable customer service. A promise we still pride ourselves on keeping today.

We’re looking for talented, passionate people to help continue his legacy.

If you’re successful, you’ll join our vibrant team in making Dan Murphy’s a world leader in customer service. You’ll enjoy a great company culture, plus access to great employee benefits and training programs. Dan Murphy’s people are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for our customers, our team, our communities and our business then we should connect.

Your track record of leading and managing change coupled with 3 to 5 years of retail management experience will see you be successful in this role. Your energy, edge and love of a fast-paced working environment are also crucial.
